action.description:
Optional, indicates the action to be taken after recognition
Defaults to DoNothing when not filled in

sub.description:
Optional, subtask. Will execute each subtask in turn after executing the current task
It is possible to nest the sub-tasks, sub-tasks can be nested with sub-tasks. But be careful not to write a dead loop

subErrorIgnored.description:
Optional, whether or not to ignore errors from sub-tasks. Default is false
WIf false, if a subtask fails, the execution of the subsequent tasks will not be continued (which is equivalent to an error in this task)
If true, it has no effect on whether a subtask has an error or not

next.description:
Optional, indicates the next task to be executed after the current task
It will be identified from front to back, and the first matching task will be executed
 If not filled in, the current task will be stopped by default

maxTimes.description:
Optional, indicates the maximum number of times the task can be executed
Default is infinite, if not filled in
After reaching the maximum number of times, if there is exceededNext field, execute exceededNext; otherwise, the task will be stopped directly

exceededNext.description:
Optional, indicates the task to be executed after reaching the maximum number of executions
If not filled in, it will stop when it reaches the maximum number of executions; If filled in, it will execute the tasks here, not the ones in next

onErrorNext.description: Optional, indicates the subsequent tasks to be executed in the event of an execution error

preDelay.description: Optional, indicates how long the action will be delayed after recognition, in milliseconds; default is 0, if not filled in

postDelay.description: Optional, indicates how long the action will be delayed before recognising next, in milliseconds; default is 0, if not filled in

roi.description:
Optional, indicates the recognition range, the format is [x, y, width, height]
Automatic scaling based on 1280 * 720; default [0, 0, 1280, 720]
Fill in as much as possible to reduce the recognition range. This can reduce performance consumption and speed up recognition

rectMove.description:
Optional, movethe target after recognition, this option is not recommended. Automatic scaling based on 1280 * 720
For example, if an A icon is recognised, but the actual location to be clicked is a position next to the A icon, then move it and click it. If possible, try to recognise the position to be clicked directly, this option is not recommended
When the action is Swipe, it means the end of the swipe

reduceOtherTimes.description: Optional, decrements the execution count of other tasks after execution

specificRect.description:
Valid and mandatory when the action is ClickRect, indicates the specified click position (a random point within the range), auto-scaling based on 1280 * 720
Valid and mandatory when the action is Swipe, indicates the starting point of the swipe

specialParams.description: Special parameters used for certain tasks (mostly handwritten thresholds, etc.)

JustReturnTask.description: Execute the action without identifying it

template.description:
Optional, the file name of the image to be matched
Defauts to "task name.png", If not filled

templThreshold.description:
Optional, the threshold of the matching score of the template image, it is considered recognised if it exceeds the threshold
Defaults to 0.8, you can check what the actual score is based on the log

maskRange.description: Optional, grey scale mask range. For example, paint the part of the image that does not need to be recognised as black (grey value is 0), and then set [1, 255], the blackened part will be ignored when matching

text.description: Mandatory, the text content to be recognised, as long as any one of them matches, it is considered to have been recognised

ocrReplace.description: Optional, replacement of commonly misrecognised text (supports regex)
